summary: The document is a secret memorandum from 12 June 1967, addressed to Mr. Marvin Wehking, the Deputy Director of Security Investigation and Operational Support. It pertains to the establishment of official cover for Peter J. DiGervino for his assignment to Madrid, Spain. The memorandum seeks to determine if DiGervino has been voluntarily declared to or involuntarily exposed by foreign governments and intelligence/security services, and if there are any records of exposure, compromise, or other security concerns. The information is urgently requested by 19 June 1967. This document is part of the records associated with the President John F. Kennedy Assassination Records Act of 1992.
key_findings: The document is related to the President John F. Kennedy Assassination Records Act of 1992.
It involves a security clearance inquiry for Peter J. DiGervino's assignment to Madrid, Spain.
The memorandum aims to identify any security risks or exposures DiGervino might have with foreign entities.
The request is marked as urgent, with a deadline of 19 June 1967.
keywords: President John F. Kennedy Assassination Records Act of 1992
